meanings.def: a very sad event or situation, especially one that involves death
examples: It's a tragedy that she died so young.
Tragedy struck the family when their son was hit by a car and killed.
The whole affair ended in tragedy.
Investigators are searching the wreckage of the plane to try to find the cause of the tragedy.
She had seen the tragedy unfold.
The closure of the factory is a tragedy for the whole community.

meanings.def: a serious play with a sad ending, especially one in which the main character dies; plays of this type
examples: Revenge tragedies were very popular in Elizabethan England.
